comment: He never responds to emails and doesn't clear instructions on what he wants. For the survey paper, he only provided a bullet point list (lit review, discussion, etc.) and no real example. I got a 100 on it but I had no idea was I getting since I didn't know whether I was doing it right.

Doesn't give clear instructions on assignments and is very unhelpful when it comes to contact. Also doesn't really teach, just has student go through a McGraw Hill courses to learn. Overall does next to nothing.

We had a heavily weighted group research project throughout the semester and we really never talked about it and the rubric was barely enough information. Our in class discussions were 80% completely unrelated topics that he wanted to go on about, and the other 20% would be about actual class content. I feel like I learned nothing.

This class is just an afterthought to him. He is unavailable and never responds to emails. Ever. Doesn't show up to his own study zooms. Reviews are useless. Some weeks go by and he doesn't load anything in the module for us to work on for the week. Schedule is a joke. Get on a class GroupMe fast for support from other students.

Mr. Kelly doesn't seem to care about anything and his grading is very weird. He didn't follow his syllabus all semester and didn't teach us a single thing about what we were supposed to do. I don't feel like I learned anything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall, great professor! I definitely recommend taking him for this course. This course is not an easy A, but definitely, an easy B. The assignments are easy (PPT presentation + 2 pg. paper) but the tests are hard. Like super hard. The tests are comprised of mostly write in and few multiple choice questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Umm the class is kinda hard and the subject is very boring. He lectures a lot without asking questions which makes it hard to really grasp the information. He always references how he used to be in a frat and how the average undergrad student is a C student. Don't be offended if he comes off as rude, its just his personality.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Tough professor but great guy! I had his night class for 3 hours which was brutal. The material was dry and the PowerPoint slides were confusing and unclear. There were pop quizzes that couldn't be passed unless you've read at least two weeks ahead. There was also a semester-long group project that took a ton of time to complete. Very tough class!

The material is so dry - reads directly from the slides.  Tests are difficult because he makes them difficult.  Not helpful with project questions.  Extremely arrogant.  Tells students he will not remember their names.  Who wants a professor that keeps reminding them they are not important.  Needs to find another profession.

He gives grading criteria for class assignments, but it wouldn't hurt him to elaborate on his expectations. His night class was almost 3 hrs. long, so it was hard to pay attention sometimes. However, the class is pretty easy. Just show up and study, and do the work. You'll pass with ease!

Not an easy class by any means. Course material is difficult. First test was written, the following tests were mostly mostly multiple choice with a few fill in the blanks. He did not give a study guide unless we asked for it. There is one group project over the whole semester in which you conduct your own research.

I had a 3 hr class for Research Methods & for the 1st half he spoke about current events w/ the class in a debate style. 2nd half, he read the PPT+adlibbed. I didn't buy the book & did just fine b/c PPTs are on D2L. Group research project - you know how those are :/ He's great & all, but NEVER RESPONDED TO ANY OF MY EMAILS. Communication professor?

Had a 3 hr class. Made it interesting & funny. You'll focus because he's great to look at btw. Few assignments that are easy (go2 colloq., interview a PR person + write a 2pg paper, 3-4 exams, 2 quizzes-1 super easy & that's about it. Attendance is for your own benefit; besides the students make it enjoyable! Test are fill in the blank. Take him.

I don't mind his class, but most of the time, he lectures off of powerpoints, so it's very boring. He does post the powerpoints on D2L as long as you keep asking him, so you can mostly study off of that. The exams are short, but the final exam is really hard: multiple choice, fill in answers, and short answers. Public speaking is okay.

took him for Research methods and hated him wastes so much time like 45 mins on current events and then rushes through the website ppts... I find class a waste of time and not needed but he takes attendance for participation points. also he tells you he will post study guide then does it the day before the test and doesnt help at all. WORST!!!

I took him for research methods. He uses the textbook power points and reads them verbatim for a "lecture". Expect the first half hour of every class to be wasted on nonsense current events. We had to beg him to post the power points. He said he was going to post a study guide for the exam but never did. Avoid him if you want to learn anything.

I always enjoy going to his class. I look forward to his class discussions. He is a hottie! Beware his tests are NOT scantron, they are handwritten!!! He is a fair grader and will give you partial credit if you are in the ballpark. I recommend taking his class!

First of all, super hott. Second, he really cares about his students and is willing to help you achieve your goals in PR. BUY THE BOOK and highlight everything he said when he does lectures. No need to take notes bc everything come from the book. Record the exam reviews and go to class. Favorite class of the semester and learned a ton.

Professor Kelly is fun.  We always talk about PR news for the first part of class, and he really likes when people speak up.  His tests are all short answer, and are difficult but he is always reasonable and fair with grading.  He is very passionate about PR and is easy on the eyes as well. Great class, read the book!
Professor Kelly is seriously the BEST professor I've taken.  Attendance is recommended, not required.  There are 3 exams, a few quizzes, and a research project.  I made a B with little effort.

Professor Kelly teaches a fun class. If you need powerpoints to stay focus donot take him. Hands on work on a daily basis. Read the book do assignments and be on top of your grammar and you will score an A
